required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Improving Mental Health and Physiological Stress Responses in Mothers Following Traumatic Childbirth and in Their Infants: a Randomised Controlled Trial (START)

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized controlled study aims to investigate the effects of a brief computerized intervention (the computer game "Tetris") on intrusive memories and other posttraumatic stress symptoms following an emergency cesarean section (ECS). Women who have undergone an emergency cesarian section will be randomly allocated to either the brief computerized intervention plus usual care or an attention placebo control group plus usual care within the first 6 hours following the ECS. Women and their infants will be followed up at ≤ 1 week postpartum, 6 weeks postpartum, and 6 months postpartum. It is predicted that women given the brief computerized intervention will develop fewer intrusive memories and less posttraumatic stress symptoms than those who are not. This will inform the development of a simple computerized early intervention to prevent distressing psychological symptoms after a traumatic event, such as an ECS.

primary_outcome.measure: presence and severity of PTSD symptoms: clinician-rated (mother)
primary_outcome.description: Clinician-administered PTSD scale (CAPS): subscale and total scores

primary_outcome.measure: presence and severity of PTSD symptoms: self-report (mother)
primary_outcome.description: PTSD Checklist (PCL-5): subscale and total scores

secondary_outcome.measure: presence and severity of ASD symptoms (mother)
secondary_outcome.description: Acute Stress Disorder Scale (ASDS): subscale and total scores

secondary_outcome.measure: presence and severity of PTSD symptoms: self-report (mother)
secondary_outcome.description: PTSD Checklist (PCL-5): subscale and total scores

secondary_outcome.measure: presence and severity of PTSD symptoms: clinician-rated (mother)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician-administered PTSD scale (CAPS): subscale and total scores

secondary_outcome.measure: presence and severity of anxiety symptoms (mother)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: < 6 hours after ECS, ≤ 1 week, 6 weeks, 6 months postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: anxiety subscale of Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS): subscale score
Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI): total score

secondary_outcome.measure: presence and severity of depression symptoms (mother)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: < 6 hours after ECS, ≤ 1 week, 6 weeks, 6 months postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS): total score

secondary_outcome.measure: salivary cortisol: daily profile (mother and infant)
salivary cortisol: stress reactivity (mother and infant)
heart rate variability: resting state (mother and infant)
heart rate variability: stress reactivity (mother and infant)

secondary_outcome.description: Infant Behavior Questionnaire-very short form: total and subscale scores
Bayley Scales of Infant Development (Bayley-III): clinician-rated

other_outcome.description: Modified Medical Outcomes Study Social Support Survey (MOS-8): total score
Revised Dyadic Adjustment Scale (RDAS): subscale and total scores
Parenting Stress Index - Short Form (PSI-SF): subscale and total scores
Post-delivery Perceived Stress Inventory (PDPSI): subscale and total scores
Postnatal Perceived Stress Inventory (PPSI): subscale and total scores

other_outcome.measure: presence and severity of PTSD symptoms: clinician-rated (partner)
other_outcome.description: Clinician-administered PTSD scale (CAPS): subscale and total scores

other_outcome.measure: presence and severity of PTSD symptoms: self-report (partner)
other_outcome.description: PTSD Checklist (PCL-5): subscale and total scores

other_outcome.measure: presence and severity of PTSD symptoms (partner)
other_outcome.description: Acute Stress Disorder Scale (ASDS): subscale and total scores

other_outcome.measure: presence and severity of depression symptoms (partner)
other_outcome.description: Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS): total scores

other_outcome.measure: presence and severity of anxiety symptoms (partner)
other_outcome.description: anxiety subscale of Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS): subscale score
Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI): total score

arm_group.description: Brief computerized intervention (computer game "Tetris") plus usual care in the maternity department
Attention placebo control (cognitive task for same amount of time) plus usual care in the maternity department

intervention.description: Brief computerized intervention (computer game "Tetris") plus usual care in the maternity department
Brief cognitive task plus usual care in the maternity department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Women:
- had an ECS at ≥ 34 weeks gestation
- gave birth to a live baby
- answered with a score of ≥ 2 separately for at least two out of four screening questions regarding perceived threat
- gave written consent
Partners:
- if the woman agrees to participate
- was present at the childbirth
- gave written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
Women:
- don't speak French sufficiently well to participate in assessments
- have an established intellectual disability or psychotic illness
- severe illness of mother or infant (e.g. cancer, cardiovascular disease, severe neurodevelopmental difficulties, malformations)
- infant requires intensive care
- alcohol abuse and/or illegal drug use during pregnancy
Partner:
- don't speak French sufficiently well to participate in assessments

overall_official.affiliation: University of Lausanne and Lausanne University Hospital

reference.citation: Horsch A, Vial Y, Favrod C, Harari MM, Blackwell SE, Watson P, Iyadurai L, Bonsall MB, Holmes EA. Reducing intrusive traumatic memories after emergency caesarean section: A proof-of-principle randomized controlled study. Behav Res Ther. 2017 Jul;94:36-47. doi: 10.1016/j.brat.2017.03.018. Epub 2017 Apr 6.
